If you are part of the software development world, fill our survey on developer tooling, it should take you less than 10 minutes. The first 400 respondents will win a $25 giftÂ card.

Not All Zeros are Equal â€” Thereâ€™s an established â€˜best practiceâ€™ that CSS authors (as well as many linters and minifiers) should remove units from any 0 value. Miriam explains that itâ€™s â€œa fine rule in most cases, but there are a few common situations where it will break yourÂ codeâ€.

It highlights the work of pioneering blind programmers who have been at work creating the tools their community needs forÂ decades.

Sheon Han

This article points out a few design choices to consider that can make longer content nicer to read â€”Â plus thereâ€™s a roundup of goodÂ examples.

Daniel Schwarz

Finer Grained Control Over CSS Transforms with Individual Transform Properties â€” You can now use the individual translate, rotate, and scale CSS properties across all major browser (support just got added to Chrome), making it easier to animate individualÂ values.

Bramus & Baron

Fluid Sizing Instead of Multiple Media Queries? â€” Like math and CSS? Youâ€™ll love this one. Ruslan explains how we donâ€™t necessarily require media queries to change values of certain CSS properties (such as font-size, padding, margin).

This new version was rebuilt from scratch, and adds MDX support, a new plugin system, theming, dark mode, SPA navigation, offline support, andÂ more. There's a demo here.
